pull.title: Building Environment: Set ARFLAGS to cr
pull.body:
Override the default of ARFLAGS of `cru` to `cr`.

When building, ar produces a warning for each archive, for example
```
  AR       libbitcoin_server.a
/usr/bin/ar: `u' modifier ignored since `D' is the default (see `U')

```
Since `u` is the default anyway, it cannot hurt to remove it.

events.body:
Concept ACK

Nit: I don't think that `u` is the default - IIRC it is just that `u` optimization has no effect when running in deterministic mode (`D`), which is now the default.

Concept ACK. Though, please don't hard-code it to "cr" in case the change causes trouble for some toolchain. Let's use AC_ARG_VAR instead, so that it may be overridden if necessary:
```bash
AC_ARG_VAR(ARFLAGS, [flags passed to the archiver])
if test "x${ARFLAGS+set}" != "xset"; then
  ARFLAGS="cr"
fi
```
I agree / have created a hopefully improved pull request: [10782](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/10782)

utACK bb4bb93216c47276b16e89bd0ba2632c801caddf
@ReneNyffenegger: can you squash the commits? Your first commit (bb4bb93216c47276b16e89bd0ba2632c801caddf) has "unrecoggnized author".
I've squashed to commits / Hope the user is now recognized.
Concept ACK, though I tested and overriding doesnt work.

overriding didn't work.... because I goofed up when I manually tried to merge two branches: I had 
    `if test "x${ARFLAGS}"...`
instead of
    `if test "x${ARFLAGS+set}"...`

With the fix, I've also added the `D` flag
Apparently, the `D` flag is not liked in the Darwin environment.
Heh, ok, just leave it as cr I suppose.

I have removed the D flag again. Now, I have also commit [816aa59](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/10766/commits/816aa59e0be4b3e31e43c4bd0ffda86ac2e9095d). I don't know why this is, if I should remove it, and how I could remove it.

@ReneNyffenegger Please do:

```shell
git rebase -i HEAD~2
# remove the line with "Fix multi_rpc test …"
git push -f
```

events.message:
Use AC_ARG_VAR to set ARFLAGS.

The user can set ARFLAGS in the ./configure step with
  ./configure ARFLAGS=...
If he chooses not to do so, ARFLAGS will be set to cr.

events.body: ACK 912da1dcc8e52228582f36b0010b498ebc76754b. We'll need to do something about similar warnings in leveldb and secp256k1, but those will need to be submitted separately upstream.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -19,6 +19,12 @@ BITCOIN_GUI_NAME=bitcoin-qt
 BITCOIN_CLI_NAME=bitcoin-cli
 BITCOIN_TX_NAME=bitcoin-tx
 
+dnl Unless the user specified ARFLAGS, force it to be cr
+AC_ARG_VAR(ARFLAGS, [Flags for the archiver, defaults to <cr> if not set])
+if test "x${ARFLAGS}" != "xset"; then
comments.body: Do you need the x${ARFLAGS+set} syntax that we use elsewhere?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -19,6 +19,12 @@ BITCOIN_GUI_NAME=bitcoin-qt
 BITCOIN_CLI_NAME=bitcoin-cli
 BITCOIN_TX_NAME=bitcoin-tx
 
+dnl Unless the user specified ARFLAGS, force it to be cr
+AC_ARG_VAR(ARFLAGS, [Flags for the archiver, defaults to <cr> if not set])
+if test "x${ARFLAGS}" != "xset"; then
+  ARFLAGS="cr"
comments.body: Maybe add D to the default here, so that we're consistent even on platforms with a strange ar build?
